title: Cliff Richard, who turns 79 today, will go on tour to mark his 80th birthday
text:
Cliff Richard has announced a new tour to mark his 80th birthday.

The singer, who is 79 today, will treat his fans to a series of shows starting in Gateshead next September.

'The Great 80' tour will end with two dates at the Royal Albert Hall in London.

Sir Cliff, who released his first album in 1959, is the only musician with number ones in five consecutive decades. 'The Great 80' tour will end with two dates at the Royal Albert Hall in London

Asked whether he ever planned to give up showbusiness, Sir Cliff has said: 'The word 'retire' – I don't think that's in my vocabulary. What I plan to do is what I've done now, really. I've slowed, I've made it a level area – I don't tour for five or six months the way I used to. I can come back with my band – they're all friends of mine.'

Sir Cliff, who released his first album in 1959, is the only musician with number ones in five consecutive decades.
description: The singer, who is 79 today, will treat his fans to a series of shows starting in Gateshead next September. 'The Great 80' tour will end with two dates at the Royal Albert Hall in London.
